alert.note: Alert for Boone (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 27 at 10:14PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The following counties, in Northern Kentucky, Boone and Kenton. In Southwest Ohio, Hamilton. * WHEN...Until 115 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1014 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Cincinnati, Florence, Erlanger, Edgewood, Elsmere, Cheviot, Fort Mitchell, Villa Hills, Fort Wright, Crescent Springs, Crestview Hills, Lakeside Park, Burlington, Oakbrook, Cleves, Shawnee, Delhi Township, Delhi Hills, Mack and Delshire.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
